post_text: San Juan School District is excited to release our student re-entry plan for the 2020-21 school year. The plan will be formally approved by the School Board in the upcoming July 16th board meeting and shortly there after released to the public. The plan has been developed after seeking input from parents, staff, and local health department officials. It will include options for parents to choose according to individual comfort level and personal preference. Please be patient as last necessary steps are being completed. Thank you for your continued collaboration and support. Superintendent Nielson
text: San Juan School District is excited to release our student re-entry plan for the 2020-21 school year. The plan will be formally approved by the School Board in the upcoming July 16th board meeting and shortly there after released to the public. The plan has been developed after seeking input from parents, staff, and local health department officials. It will include options for parents to choose according to individual comfort level and personal preference. Please be patient as last necessary steps are being completed. Thank you for your continued collaboration and support. Superintendent Nielson

post_text: San Juan School District Administration has been made aware of a possible social media threat towards San Juan High School. We are working closely with local Law Enforcement, and are confident that there is no eminent danger to our students and staff. You will see an increased law enforcement presence at Blanding Area Schools on Tuesday October 1st. As always if something appears out of the ordinary please report it to the appropriate authority.
text: San Juan School District Administration has been made aware of a possible social media threat towards San Juan High School. We are working closely with local Law Enforcement, and are confident that there is no eminent danger to our students and staff. You will see an increased law enforcement presence at Blanding Area Schools on Tuesday October 1st. As always if something appears out of the ordinary please report it to the appropriate authority.

post_text:
We would like to inform you of the upcoming evacuation and parent reunification drill scheduled at San Juan High on Monday, April 15, sometime in the morning. The drill will be as realistic as possible and will involve the community, county, and state law enforcement and EMS services. Please be prepared for a lot of activity around the area of San Juan High on that day. We expect the drill to last up to 2 hours and again, will be as realistic as possible.

With that being said, I am looking for 15 to 20 parents who are willing to be called to pick up their student(s) at the reunification point on the north side of the football field at the stairs leading to the field. Please call Mr. Peterson @ 678-1374, Ryan Nielson @ 678-1372, or the front desk @ 678-130.

Regards,

Bob Peterson, Principal

post_text: https://www.facebook.com/UtahTreasurer/videos/245942896341549/
shared_text:
Utah Office of State Treasurer
February 20, 2019 at 3:58 PM ¬∑

We're grateful for the incredible collaboration that has paved the way for a new Bluff Elementary School! Join us on February 26 for the groundbreaking ceremony. The land swap of the Utah Navajo Trust Fund's fairground property in Bluff for the San Juan School District's property in Monument Valley (where the UNTF Monument Valley Health Clinic sits) is a win-win for Utah Navajos. The Trust Fund perfects its interest in the Monument Valley property, and the District can now build a new Bluff Elementary! Many months of hard work will soon pay off for the students and families served by the school.
text:
https://www.facebook.com/UtahTreasurer/videos/245942896341549/

Utah Office of State Treasurer
February 20, 2019 at 3:58 PM ¬∑

We're grateful for the incredible collaboration that has paved the way for a new Bluff Elementary School! Join us on February 26 for the groundbreaking ceremony. The land swap of the Utah Navajo Trust Fund's fairground property in Bluff for the San Juan School District's property in Monument Valley (where the UNTF Monument Valley Health Clinic sits) is a win-win for Utah Navajos. The Trust Fund perfects its interest in the Monument Valley property, and the District can now build a new Bluff Elementary! Many months of hard work will soon pay off for the students and families served by the school.

üåµInfluence and motivate others to reach their potential

post_text:
"I don't think anyone has a gorgeous of a morning walk to work as I do...it's really something else." -Jody Lee-Chadde, 4th grade teacher.

We took Mrs. Lee-Chadde years of quality teaching experience and paid her accordingly to come teach our children in our school district.

We call it the Quality Teaching Incentive Program, find about more about it and continue watching the video here https://bit.ly/2wV4LVm.

We are looking for Quality Teaching Incentive Program applicants NOW in our San Juan Schools to join our staff this coming school year.

San Juan School District has much to offer, including a high salary for our teachers and we even provide housing. Are you ready to start your adventure? Click here to apply https://bit.ly/2IeXODG.

Feel free to tag a friend or share with those who would be great candidates!

We are thankful for our board members, and the staff members for all their hard work this school year!

post_text:
School is almost out for the summer! Let's not forget Superintendent Nielson's message from when we started this year!

"It is my belief that every child deserves an effective teacher within a highly successful school. As Superintendent, it will be my goal to facilitate a system where the Board of Education, staff, parents, students, and stakeholders are unified in vision and effort to provide just that for all 3,000 students attending a SJSD school. Please join us in our QUEST to serve your child and all children in San Juan School District and ‚ÄúTo Empower‚Äù them to new heights. Thank you so much for your support in making this a great year!"
-Superintendent Ron Nielson
